title: Sun Bum Kids SPF 50 Clear Spray - Finally, a Sunscreen That Doesn't Fight Back
metaDescription: Honest review of Sun Bum Kids SPF 50 clear spray sunscreen. Works on wet skin, no white residue, but has some quirks parents should know about.
content:
## Look, I'll be straight with you - most kids' sunscreens are terrible

They're thick, leave kids looking like ghosts, and trying to apply them while they're already wet from the pool? Forget about it. That's what made me skeptical when I first grabbed this Sun Bum Kids SPF 50 clear spray. But honestly, it's been a game-changer for our family beach days.

## What actually works about this stuff

The clear formula is the real deal. I'm not talking about slightly-less-white - I mean actually clear. When you spray it on, you can see exactly where it went, which is huge when you're trying to cover a squirmy kid who just wants to get back in the water.

The wet skin application thing isn't just marketing fluff either. I've used this straight on my daughter when she's dripping wet from the ocean, and it still spreads and absorbs properly. Most sunscreens just bead up and slide right off wet skin, but this one actually sticks around and does its job.

Vitamin E is mixed in there too, which I appreciate since my kids have pretty sensitive skin. It doesn't seem to cause any irritation, even on my son who breaks out from half the products we try.

## The spray mechanism is pretty solid

The nozzle gives you good coverage without being too forceful. You know how some spray sunscreens feel like they're sandblasting your face? This one's much gentler. The 6-ounce size is perfect for throwing in a beach bag - big enough to actually protect a family but not so huge it takes up half your space.

## Hawaii compliance matters more than you think

This sunscreen doesn't have octinoxate or oxybenzone, which means it's compliant with Hawaii's reef protection laws. Even if you're not heading to Hawaii, these chemicals aren't great for marine life anywhere. Plus, some people are sensitive to them, so it's nice to have a formula that skips the potentially problematic ingredients.

## Where it gets a bit annoying

The spray pattern isn't perfectly even - sometimes you get more product in some spots than others. You really need to pay attention and make sure you're getting good coverage, especially on kids who won't sit still.

It also has that typical sunscreen smell. Not terrible, but it's definitely there. Some people love that coconut-beach scent, but if you're sensitive to fragrances, heads up.

The biggest issue? You burn through this stuff pretty quickly with multiple kids. The 6-ounce bottle seems reasonable until you realize you're reapplying every couple hours on active kids who are in and out of the water.

## FSA/HSA eligible is a nice bonus

If you've got a health savings account, you can use those funds for this sunscreen. It's one of those little perks that adds up when you're buying sunscreen regularly through the summer.

## Real talk on protection

SPF 50 gives you solid protection when applied properly. The key word there is properly - you still need to use enough product and reapply regularly. This isn't magic armor, it's just really good sunscreen that's easier to apply than most.

I've tested this through full days at the beach, pool parties, and backyard sprinkler sessions. When used correctly, it really does prevent burns. My kids are pretty fair-skinned, and we haven't had any breakthrough burns when using this consistently.

## Who should actually get this

This is perfect for parents who are tired of fighting with thick, goopy sunscreens. If you've got active kids who hate the sunscreen application process, the clear formula and wet-skin application make life so much easier. It's also great for families who spend a lot of time around water since you don't have to towel kids completely dry before reapplying.

Honestly, even adults will probably prefer this over traditional sunscreens for beach days. The convenience factor is just too good to pass up.
pros: Actually goes on clear without white residue
Works on wet skin without beading up
Gentle spray nozzle that won't blast sensitive areas
Contains vitamin E for sensitive skin
Hawaii reef-safe formula without harsh chemicals
FSA/HSA eligible for health account purchases
6-ounce size perfect for travel and beach bags
cons: Spray pattern can be uneven requiring careful attention
Has noticeable sunscreen scent that may bother sensitive noses
Goes through product quickly with multiple active kids
verdict: This clear spray sunscreen actually delivers on its promises and makes protecting active kids way less of a battle. Sure, it's not perfect, but the convenience and effectiveness make it worth keeping in your summer rotation.
targetAudience: Parents with active children who spend time around water, families looking for reef-safe sunscreen options, and anyone tired of dealing with thick white sunscreen formulas
